p: GLC showed the antihyperglycemic effect in diabetic mice, and literature acknowledged that GLC exerts its effect by selectively blocking the ATP sensitive K + channels (K ATP) in the β-cells of the pancreas. Then, blockage of KATP results in the influx of Ca 2+ to cells which, in turn, cause depolarization in the cytosol with subsequent insulin secretion [ 39]. In this study, there was blood glucose lowering brought about by GLC-induced secretion of insulin from pancreatic β-cells; this indicates that a single dose of STZ at 150 mg/kg could not cause absolute destruction of β-cells.
